00065     /// @internal
00066     /// @namespace phys::internal
00067     /// @brief This namespace is used for internal helper classes, and in general it should be ignored by game developers
00068     /// @details This whole internal namespace is a home for dirty hacks and internal dependant code. This is where code goes that must implement classes or functions for the various subsytems the Physgame engine draws on.
00069     namespace internal
00070     {
00071         /// @internal
00072         /// @brief SDL uses this to filter events it presents to applications
00073         /// @details This is used used to filter out SQL_quit messages, and generate appropriate messages for the game developer to use.
00074         /// This will always drop quit events, and store that information for later use.
00075         /// @param event This is the event SDL expects use to filters, To get real data from this we setup it up so that if the event is a null pointer the function will return data about quit messages
00076         /// @param userdata Nothing, a dummy argument that could be used by SDL
00077         /// @warning Do not use this. It can only cause problems. This is for SDL, the user input subsystem, to filter certain events.
00078         /// @return This will always return either 0 or 1 to SDL. 0 if it should drop the event, which it does to all SDL_quit events, 1 if the event should be allowed, which it does to all events which are not SDL_quit events. If a null pointer was passed, then this will return 4 if it dropped an SDL_Quit, and 2 if it has not droppped an SDL_quit.
00079         //int PhysSDLFilter(void *userdata, const SDL_Event *event,  );
00080         //If this is passed an event that points to 0 it will function as a method to tell us if an SDL_QUIT message has been thrown
00081         //this will return 2 if it has not seen an SDL_quit, and a 4 if it has
00082         int PhysSDLFilter(void *userdata, SDL_Event *event )
00083         {
00084             //We need to protect this thing with a Mutex, SDL 1.3 says this filter could run in different thread.
00085             static bool DroppedQuit=false;
00086 
00087             if(event!=0)                //if this is a real event
00088             {
00089                 if ( event->type == SDL_QUIT )
00090                 {
00091                     DroppedQuit=true;   //Drop all quit events, and track that we dropped them
00092                     return 0;
00093                 }
00094                 return 1;
00095             }else{
00096                 if(DroppedQuit)         //4 if we need to make a quit event
00097                 {
00098                     DroppedQuit=false;  //Reset this so we don't add more in the future by accident
00099                     return 4;
00100                 }
00101                 return 2;
00102             }
00103         }
00104 
00105         /// @internal
00106         /// @brief Used to increase encapsulation, just a bit.
00107         struct EventManagerInternalData
00108         {
00109             //The Queue that all the events get stored in
00110             std::list<EventBase*> EventQ;
00111 
00112             /// @internal
00113             /// @brief The kinds of data that can be stored in Manual Check
00114             enum PollingType{
00115                 Polling     =1,
00116                 Keypress    =2
00117             };
00118 
00119             /// @internal
00120             /// @brief A unified polling and event repeater
00121             /// the Inputcode is the kind of event to check for each frame. The PollingType is a bitfield used to control what can turn and of the pollingcheck check.
00122             std::map<MetaCode::InputCode, PollingType> ManualCheck;
00123 
00124             /// @internal
00125             typedef std::map<MetaCode::InputCode, PollingType>::iterator ManualCheckIterator;
00126 
00127             /// @internal
00128             /// @brief Adds one type of polling check
00129             /// @param OneCode The code that will be check for each frame, under the new condition
00130             /// @param _PollingCheck This is inserted into a new polling check or it is bitwise or'ed into an existing one, and this will trigger other parts of the code to insert event later on
00131             void AddInputCodeToManualCheck(const MetaCode::InputCode& OneCode, PollingType _PollingCheck)
00132             {
00133                 ManualCheckIterator Which = ManualCheck.find(OneCode);
00134                 if(ManualCheck.end() == Which )
00135                 {
00136                     ManualCheck[OneCode] = _PollingCheck;
00137                 }else{
00138                     Which->second = (PollingType)(Which->second | _PollingCheck); //An Item can be multiple kinds of polling checks
00139                 }
00140             }
00141 
00142             /// @internal
00143             /// @brief Used to insert Codes into the list of items to be manually checked
00144             /// @param Transport A vector of every Meta that may need to be added to the list
00145             void AddMetaCodesToManualCheck(vector<MetaCode> Transport, PollingType _PollingCheck)
00146             {
00147                 for ( vector<MetaCode>::iterator Iter=Transport.begin(); Iter!=Transport.end(); ++Iter)
00148                 {
00149                     MetaCode::InputCode temp = Iter->GetCode();
00150                     AddInputCodeToManualCheck(Iter->GetCode(), _PollingCheck);
00151                 }
00152             }
00153 
00154             /// @internal
00155             /// @brief Removes one type of polling check
00156             /// @param OneCode The code that will no longer be checked each frame, under the given condition
00157             /// @param _PollingCheck This is the polling into a new polling check or it is bitwise or'ed into an existing one, and this will trigger other parts of the code to insert event later on
00158             void RemoveInputCodeToManualCheck(const MetaCode::InputCode& OneCode, PollingType _PollingCheck)
00159             {
00160                 ManualCheckIterator Which = ManualCheck.find(OneCode);
00161                 if( ManualCheck.end() != Which )
00162                 {
00163                     if(Which->second == _PollingCheck)
00164                         { ManualCheck.erase(Which); }                           // if they are are equal then this
00165                     else
00166                         { Which->second = (PollingType)(Which->second & (~_PollingCheck)); }
00167                 }
00168             }
00169 
00170             /// @internal
00171             /// @brief Remove Items form the internal manual check list
00172             /// @param Transport A vector of every MetaCode that may need to be removed to the list
00173             void RemoveMetaCodesToManualCheck(vector<MetaCode> Transport, PollingType _PollingCheck)
00174             {
00175                 for ( vector<MetaCode>::iterator Iter=Transport.begin(); Iter!=Transport.end(); ++Iter)
00176                     { RemoveInputCodeToManualCheck(Iter->GetCode(), _PollingCheck); }
00177             }
00178 
00179         };
00180 
00181     } // /internal
00182 
00183     /// @todo TODO: Make the EventManager completely thread safe. IF this is completely thread safe, we can spawn numerous individual thread each accessing this and
00184     /// and the performance gain would almost scale directly with cpu core count increases. Look at boost scoped_lock
00185     EventManager::EventManager()
00186     {
00187         this->Priority=-40;
00188         this->_Data = new internal::EventManagerInternalData;
00189 
00190         //Remove GameWorld Pointer From everything
00191         this->GameWorld = World::GetWorldPointer();
00192     }
00193 
00194     EventManager::~EventManager()
00195     {
00196         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); Iter++)
00197             { delete *Iter; }
00198         delete _Data;
00199     }

00201     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00202     //These functions will give you the next event or help you manage the events
00203     ///////////////////////////////////////
00204     size_t EventManager::GetRemainingEventCount()
00205         { return _Data->EventQ.size(); }
00206 
00207     EventBase* EventManager::GetNextEvent()
00208     {
00209         if(_Data->EventQ.empty())
00210             { return 0; }
00211         EventBase* results = _Data->EventQ.front();
00212         return results;
00213     }
00214 
00215     EventBase* EventManager::PopNextEvent()
00216     {
00217         if(_Data->EventQ.empty())
00218             { return 0; }
00219         EventBase* results = _Data->EventQ.front();
00220         _Data->EventQ.pop_front();
00221         return results;
00222     }
00223 
00224     void EventManager::RemoveNextEvent()
00225         { _Data->EventQ.pop_front(); }
00226 
00227     void EventManager::AddEvent(EventBase* EventToAdd)
00228         { _Data->EventQ.push_back(EventToAdd); }

00230     void EventManager::UpdateEvents()
00231     {
00232         UpdateQuitEvents(); //quit events skips the preprocessing step and goes straight into the the main Queue, becuase of how we need to get them from sdl
00233 
00234         RawEvent FromSDLRaw;                                    //used to hold data as we go through loop
00235         EventUserInput* FromSDLEvent = new EventUserInput();    //Used to build up all of our userinput data into one event
00236 
00237 
00238         /* Here is a list of SDL event which aren't coded yet.
00239         //event types
00240             SDL_FIRSTEVENT                              unused (do not remove)          Application events
00241             SDL_QUIT                            user-requested quit             Window events
00242          SDL_WINDOWEVENT                                window state change
00243          SDL_SYSWMEVENT                         system specific event           Keyboard events
00244             SDL_KEYDOWN                         key pressed
00245             SDL_KEYUP                           key released
00246         SDL_TEXTEDITING                         keyboard text editing (composition)
00247         SDL_TEXTINPUT                           keyboard text input             Mouse events
00248             SDL_MOUSEMOTION                             mouse moved
00249             SDL_MOUSEBUTTONDOWN                         mouse button pressed
00250             SDL_MOUSEBUTTONUP                           mouse button released
00251         SDL_MOUSEWHEEL                          mouse wheel motion              Tablet or multiple mice input device events
00252         SDL_INPUTMOTION                         input moved
00253         SDL_INPUTBUTTONDOWN                             input button pressed
00254         SDL_INPUTBUTTONUP                               input button released
00255         SDL_INPUTWHEEL                          input wheel motion
00256         SDL_INPUTPROXIMITYIN                            input pen entered proximity
00257         SDL_INPUTPROXIMITYOUT                           input pen left proximity                Joystick events
00258         SDL_JOYAXISMOTION                               joystick axis motion
00259         SDL_JOYBALLMOTION                               joystick trackball motion
00260         SDL_JOYHATMOTION                                joystick hat position change
00261         SDL_JOYBUTTONDOWN                               joystick button pressed
00262         SDL_JOYBUTTONUP                         joystick button released                Touch events
00263         SDL_FINGERDOWN
00264         SDL_FINGERUP
00265         SDL_FINGERMOTION
00266         SDL_TOUCHBUTTONDOWN
00267         SDL_TOUCHBUTTONUP                               Gesture events
00268         SDL_DOLLARGESTURE
00269         SDL_DOLLARRECORD
00270         SDL_MULTIGESTURE                                Clipboard events
00271         SDL_CLIPBOARDUPDATE                             the clipboard changed           Obsolete events
00272         SDL_EVENT_COMPAT1                               SDL 1.2 events for compatibility
00273         SDL_EVENT_COMPAT2                               SDL 1.2 events for compatibility
00274         SDL_EVENT_COMPAT3                               SDL 1.2 events for compatibility                These are for your use, and should be allocated with
00275         SDL_RegisterEvents()
00276         SDL_USEREVENT                           a user-specified event
00277         SDL_LASTEVENT                           only for bounding internal arrays
00278         */
00279 
00280         while(SDL_PollEvent(&FromSDLRaw))
00281         {
00282             switch(FromSDLRaw.type)
00283             {
00284             /*    case SDL_ACTIVEEVENT:   //when the window gains focus
00285                 case SDL_VIDEORESIZE:   //when the screen is resized
00286                 case SDL_VIDEOEXPOSE:   //when the windows goes from being hidden to being shown
00287                 case SDL_SYSWMEVENT:
00288                 case SDL_USEREVENT:
00289                     /// @todo handle unhandled user system events
00290                     //_Data->EventQ.push_back(FromSDLEvent);
00291                     break;
00292             */
00293                 case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONUP:     case SDL_KEYUP:             //case SDL_JOYBUTTONUP:
00294                     _Data->RemoveMetaCodesToManualCheck( FromSDLEvent->AddCodesFromRawEvent(FromSDLRaw), internal::EventManagerInternalData::Keypress);
00295                     break;
00296 
00297                 case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:   case SDL_KEYDOWN:           //case SDL_JOYBUTTONDOWN:
00298                     _Data->AddMetaCodesToManualCheck( FromSDLEvent->AddCodesFromRawEvent(FromSDLRaw), internal::EventManagerInternalData::Keypress);
00299                     break;
00300 
00301                 case SDL_MOUSEMOTION:       //case SDL_JOYAXISMOTION:     case SDL_JOYBALLMOTION:     case SDL_JOYHATMOTION:
00302                     FromSDLEvent->AddCodesFromRawEvent(FromSDLRaw);
00303                     break;
00304 
00305 
00306                 case SDL_FIRSTEVENT:  //capture and ignore
00307                     break;
00308 
00309                 case SDL_WINDOWEVENT:
00310                     this->AddEvent(new EventGameWindow(FromSDLRaw));
00311                     break;
00312 
00313                 case SDL_SYSWMEVENT:
00314                         // call a function with ifdefs here
00315                     break;
00316 
00317                 case SDL_QUIT:          //when SDL closes, but this really should be handled somewhere else, like the UpdateQuitEvents() function
00318                     World::GetWorldPointer()->LogAndThrow("Unexpected Quit event in event manager.");
00319                     break;
00320 
00321                 default:                //Never thrown by SDL, but could be added by a user
00322                     //World::GetWorldPointer()->LogAndThrow("Unknown SDL Event Inserted.");
00323                     World::GetWorldPointer()->Log("Unknown SDL Event Inserted. Likely an unhandled SDL 1.3 event");
00324                     break;
00325             }
00326         }
00327 
00328         // Here we iterate through manual check to insert any requested polling checks and perpetuate mousedown events
00329         for(internal::EventManagerInternalData::ManualCheckIterator Iter=_Data->ManualCheck.begin(); _Data->ManualCheck.end()!=Iter; ++Iter)
00330         {
00331             MetaCode::InputCode temp = (*Iter).first;
00332             bool found=false;
00333             for(EventUserInput::iterator LIter=FromSDLEvent->begin(); FromSDLEvent->end()!=LIter; ++LIter)
00334             {
00335                 if (Iter->first == LIter->GetCode())
00336                 {
00337                     found=true;
00338                     break;
00339                 }
00340             }
00341             if(!found)
00342             {
00343                 if(internal::EventManagerInternalData::Keypress & Iter->second)     //if the keypress event is in there, then the key must be down
00344                     { FromSDLEvent->AddCode(MetaCode::BUTTON_DOWN, Iter->first); }
00345                 else
00346                     { FromSDLEvent->AddCode(MetaCode::BUTTON_UP, Iter->first); }    //It must be just a polling check
00347             }
00348         }
00349 
00350         //Check to see if we should add a User input event or not. We wouldn't want to pass an empty event
00351         if(FromSDLEvent->GetMetaCodeCount()==0)
00352         {
00353             delete FromSDLEvent;
00354         }else{
00355             _Data->EventQ.push_back(FromSDLEvent);
00356         }
00357     }
00358 
00359     void EventManager::UpdateQuitEvents()
00360     {
00361 //        if (NULL == SDL_GetEventFilter())                       //Verify the Event filter is installed, if not, then install it.
00362         if(SDL_FALSE == SDL_GetEventFilter(0, 0))
00363         {
00364             SDL_SetEventFilter( internal::PhysSDLFilter, 0);
00365         }else{
00366             if(4==internal::PhysSDLFilter(0,0))                   //Pass it a null pointer to get it to "Not Callback Mode"
00367             {
00368                 this->AddEvent(new EventQuit());                //We need to make a quit event
00369             }else{
00370                 //all clear
00371             }
00372         }
00373     }

00375     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00376     // Filtered management functions - You choose YAYYYY!!!
00377     ///////////////////////////////////////
00378     EventBase* EventManager::GetNextSpecificEvent(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00379     {
00380         EventBase* results = 0;
00381         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00382         {
00383             if((*Iter)->GetType()==SpecificType)
00384             {
00385                 results = (*Iter);
00386                 return results;
00387             }
00388         }
00389         return results;
00390     }
00391 
00392     EventBase* EventManager::PopNextSpecificEvent(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00393     {
00394         EventBase* results = 0;
00395         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00396         {
00397             if((*Iter)->GetType()==SpecificType)
00398             {
00399                 results = (*Iter);
00400                 _Data->EventQ.erase(Iter);
00401                 return results;
00402             }
00403         }
00404         return results;
00405     }
00406 
00407     void EventManager::RemoveNextSpecificEvent(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00408     {
00409         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00410         {
00411             if((*Iter)->GetType()==SpecificType)
00412                 { _Data->EventQ.erase(Iter); }
00413         }
00414     }
00415 
00416     std::list<EventBase*>* EventManager::GetAllSpecificEvents(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00417     {
00418         std::list<EventBase*>* TempList = new std::list<EventBase*>;
00419 
00420         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00421         {
00422             if((*Iter)->GetType()==SpecificType)
00423             {
00424                 TempList->push_back(*Iter);
00425             }
00426         }
00427         return TempList;
00428     }
00429 
00430     void EventManager::RemoveAllSpecificEvents(EventBase::EventType SpecificType)
00431     {
00432         for(std::list<EventBase*>::iterator Iter = _Data->EventQ.begin(); Iter!=_Data->EventQ.end(); ++Iter)
00433         {
00434             if((*Iter)->GetType()==SpecificType)
00435             {
00436                 this->_Data->EventQ.remove(*Iter);
00437             }
00438         }
00439     }

00505     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00506     // Polling Functions
00507     ///////////////////////////////////////
00508     void EventManager::AddPollingCheck(const MetaCode &InputToTryPolling)
00509     {
00510         if(InputToTryPolling.IsPollable())
00511         {
00512             this->_Data->AddInputCodeToManualCheck(InputToTryPolling.GetCode(), internal::EventManagerInternalData::Polling);
00513         }else{
00514             World::GetWorldPointer()->LogAndThrow("Unsupported Polling Check on this Platform");
00515         }
00516     }
00517 
00518     void EventManager::RemovePollingCheck(const MetaCode &InputToStopPolling)
00519     {
00520         this->_Data->RemoveInputCodeToManualCheck(InputToStopPolling.GetCode(), internal::EventManagerInternalData::Polling);
00521     }
